alert.note: Alert for Lexington; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 5:29PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Lexington and central Richland Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 528 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking developing thunderstorms in and around the City of Columbia. These storms are nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Columbia, Lexington, West Columbia, Cayce, Irmo, Forest Acres, Oak Grove, St. Andrews, Dentsville, Arcadia Lakes, Riverbanks Zoo, SC State Fair Grounds, West Columbia Riverwalk, Columbia International University, Five Points, Seven Oaks, Olympia, Eau Claire, Guignard Park and Rosewood. This includes the following highways... Interstate 126 between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 59 and 73. Interstate 26 between mile markers 103 and 111. Interstate 77 between mile markers 11 and 12. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
